description: Create a VPC Block Public Access (BPA) exclusion. A VPC BPA exclusion is a mode that can be applied to a single VPC or subnet that exempts it from the account's BPA mode and will allow bidirectional or egress-only access. You can create BPA exclusions for VPCs and subnets even when BPA is not enabled on the account to ensure that there is no traffic disruption to the exclusions when VPC BPA is turned on. To learn more about VPC BPA, see Block public access to VPCs and subnets in the Amazon VPC User Guide.

parameters.name: InternetGatewayExclusionMode
parameters.description: The exclusion mode for internet gateway traffic. allow-bidirectional: Allow all internet traffic to and from the excluded VPCs and subnets. allow-egress: Allow outbound internet traffic from the excluded VPCs and subnets. Block inbound internet traffic to the excluded VPCs and subnets. Only applies when VPC Block Public Access is set to Bidirectional.

parameters.name: TagSpecifications
parameters.description: tag - The key/value combination of a tag assigned to the resource. Use the tag key in the filter name and the tag value as the filter value. For example, to find all resources that have a tag with the key Owner and the value TeamA, specify tag:Owner for the filter name and TeamA for the filter value. (dict) --- The tags to apply to a resource when the resource is being created. When you specify a tag, you must specify the resource type to tag, otherwise the request will fail. ResourceType (string) --- The type of resource to tag on creation. Tags (list) --- The tags to apply to the resource. (dict) --- Describes a tag. Key (string) --- The key of the tag. Constraints: Tag keys are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 127 Unicode characters. May not begin with aws:. Value (string) --- The value of the tag. Constraints: Tag values are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 256 Unicode characters.

nested_params.name: ResourceType
nested_params.description: The type of resource to tag on creation.

nested_params.name: Tags
nested_params.description: The tags to apply to the resource.

nested_params.name: Key
nested_params.description: The key of the tag. Constraints: Tag keys are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 127 Unicode characters. May not begin with aws:.

nested_params.name: Value
nested_params.description: The value of the tag. Constraints: Tag values are case-sensitive and accept a maximum of 256 Unicode characters.

nested_items.name: InternetGatewayExclusionMode
nested_items.description: The exclusion mode for internet gateway traffic.
allow-bidirectional: Allow all internet traffic to and from the excluded VPCs and subnets.

allow-egress: Allow outbound internet traffic from the excluded VPCs and subnets. Block inbound internet traffic to the excluded VPCs and subnets. Only applies when VPC Block Public Access is set to Bidirectional.

nested_items.name: Reason
nested_items.description: The reason for the current exclusion state.

nested_items.name: LastUpdateTimestamp
nested_items.description: When the exclusion was last updated.

nested_items.name: Tags
nested_items.description: tag - The key/value combination of a tag assigned to the resource. Use the tag key in the filter name and the tag value as the filter value. For example, to find all resources that have a tag with the key Owner and the value TeamA, specify tag:Owner for the filter name and TeamA for the filter value.
